meanings.definition: Of the same or similar kind or nature.
meanings.sent1: The classroom was homogenous, with all the students wearing blue uniforms.
meanings.sent2: The cookies were homogenous in size and shape, making them perfect for baking.
meanings.sent3: The garden looked homogenous with rows of identical flowers, like a colorful pattern.
meanings.sent4: The team's performance was homogenous, each player contributing equally to the win.
meanings.sent5: The music festival had a homogenous crowd, all dancing to the same beat.

meanings.definition: Consisting of parts all of the same kind.
meanings.sent1: The puzzle pieces were homogenous, making it easy to put together.
meanings.sent2: The forest was homogenous, with only one type of tree growing everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The bookshelf looked homogenous, filled with rows of identical books.
meanings.sent4: The painting had a homogenous color scheme, using only shades of blue.
meanings.sent5: The soup was homogenous, with all the vegetables chopped into the same size.
